description: From Middle English vīne, from Anglo-Norman vigne, from Vulgar Latin vīnia, from Latin vīnea (“vines in a vineyard”), from vīneus (“related to wine”), from vīnum (“wine”), from Proto-Italic *wīnom, from Proto-Indo-European *wóyh₁nom (“vine, wine”), from *weh₁y- (“to twist, wrap”). Doublet of wine.

entries.meaning: The climbing plant that produces grapes.
examples: They picked the grapes off the vine.

entries.meaning: Any plant of the genus Vitis.
(by extension) Any similar climbing or trailing plant.
